Tigercat Industries Inc. is a privately owned, customer driven company engaged in the design, manufacture, sales and service support of a wide range of premium quality, heavy duty, off-road, mechanized vehicles and attachments used in the tree harvesting and off-road industrial applications.

Tigercat offers a range of feller bunchers, skidders, loaders, loggers, harvesters, forwarders and felling and processing attachments. title: Foreman
description:
ABOUT THIS CAREER OPPORTUNITY

Black & McDonald's Western Utility team is growing! If you are an independent, enthusiastic, and driven professional searching for an opportunity to build a solid foundation for your career, this position is for you. The Foreman is located in Edmonton and will work on utility construction projects in and around Edmonton. The Foreman typically reports directly to the Project Manager.

The Foreman will assist with overall project performance and status from start to finish and in accordance with schedule, specifications and budget. They manage labour and subcontractor schedules, safety, and quality, and keep management well-informed of progress, discrepancies, questions, and any impacts on project plan and schedule. Duties and responsibilities include:

  • Establish and maintain excellent relationships with all stakeholders including Black & McDonald team members, clients, consultants, joint venture partners, trades, subcontractors, vendors, suppliers, and the community, while keeping them informed of relevant information
  • Assist in planning and preparing schedules and milestones, and monitor progress against established timelines
  • Comply and ensure work is performed in compliance with applicable HSE legislation and company policies and procedures, contract requirements, and Black & McDonald policies and procedures
  • Lead a team comprised of labour and subcontractors towards successful project completion
  • Assist the project team to ensure project objectives, schedule, budget, cash flow, policies, procedures, and performance standards are met in accordance with company policy and contract specifications
  • Participate and collaborate with the project team to plan and prepare construction schedules and milestones and execute project(s) on time, within budget, and in accordance with corporate policy
  • Report on potential problems on site, problem solve towards effective resolution

COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS

  • Communicates Effectively
  • Customer Focus
  • Holds Self and Others Accountable
  • Problem Solving and Innovation
  • Teamwork and Collaboration
  • Values and Respects Others

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS

Degree or Diploma in the following are considered an asset:

  • Construction Engineering Technology
  • Construction Management
  • Civil Engineering

The following certifications/designations are considered an asset:

  • Gold Seal Certification
  • Construction safety certifications

WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

  • 5+ years as a Foreman in the construction industry
  • Project experience in small civil and/or shallow utilities construction

SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS

Proficient knowledge and understanding of:

  • Construction scheduling, planning, and execution
  • Blue print reading
  • Project structural design interpretation
  • Established construction practices, procedures and techniques
  • Applicable local and provincial labour codes
  • Managing / leading union and non-union staff
  • Organization and time management

Proficient user of:

  • MS Office (Word, Excel, Project)
  • Can operate small machinery
  • Willing and able to travel to sites around Edmonton
  • Valid Alberta Driver's License

Black & McDonald welcomes and encourages applications from persons with disabilities. 
Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

description:

The primary focus will be to act as a working Foreman, who demonstrates and mentors crew members on the proper work methods required to complete assigned tasks safely and effectively within Alberta.


The responsibilities of this role include, but are not limited to:

SAFETY

  • Performs work in a safe and environmentally focused manner through the use of pre-job planning, hazard analysis, risk mitigation and following all applicable safe work practices and procedures.
  • Ensures workers performs tasks only when deemed competent to do so.
  • Bring forward HS&E concerns, so they can be appropriately addressed, while looking out for yourself and co-workers.
  • Ensures operation of equipment and company vehicles are in a safe and respectful manner, ensuring adherence to FBL Fleet and the HS&E program.
  • Identify and provide input into the development of safe work practices, procedures and HS&E improvements.

QUALITY

  • Ensuring quality, conformance to requirements and assigned drawings
  • Formal inspection, monitoring and reporting of crew activities to the Construction Manager or Supervisor.
  • Maintains accurate time records including phase codes and hours, quality reports and all other required job -specific paperwork.

PRODUCTIVITY

  • Plans daily activities utilizing tailboards
  • Ensure workers are fit for duty
  • Ensures tasks are completed to specification
  • Manage crew concerns and issues and elevate when required
  • Working with crew members for completing tasks
  • Ensure tailboards are done for any work deviation

CONTIOUS IMPROVEMENT

  • Identifies and makes recommendations for improvement of work methods to the leadership team at the construction site

PERFORMANCE MANAGEMENT

  • Performance evaluations of assigned employees/crew members (30,60,90 day evaluations and day-to-day performance observations)
  • Supervises all employees assigned to a specific crew/area/zone; provides feedback, enforces company practices and administers disciplinary measures as required.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

  • Journeyperson Certificate/Red Seal Certificate
  • 3 - 5 years experience working in the trade as a Journeyman
  • 1 - 3 years experience working in a Lead hand position

SKILLS AND ABILITIES

  • Strong leadership and team building skills, including the ability to lead by example, build consensus, actively listen, and engage/influence employees at all levels
  • Task-orientated with strong attention to details and follow through
  • Comfortable working in a fast paced, time sensitive environment
  • Strong ethics, professionalism, and interpersonal skills
  • Excellent organization skills and ability to manage a variety of tasks simultaneously
  • Results oriented individual with the ability to effectively manage multiple priorities and timelines
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to take and/or provide direction
  • Strong work ethic with a positive team attitude
  • Computer skills an asset

ADDITIONAL DETAILS

This position requires candidates to:

  • Successfully complete pre-employment drug and alcohol testing to obtain clearance letter for site access
  • Valid Driver's licenses and acceptable divers abstract is required, as this position requires driving and site visits
  • Requires regular travel to various project sites and office locations
  • Ability to travel to and work at project locations situated throughout North America

Your team:

  • Reporting to the Sawmill Superintendent, you will be part of a results-oriented team whose members are encouraged to exceed expectations.

Your profile:

  • Ideally a Wood Science Bachelor’s degree, technical diploma, or related industry experience
  • A minimum of 3 to 5 years of equivalent experience heavy equipment, and environmental systems
  • Demonstrated progression in leadership roles

 

Your skills:

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills;
  • Ability to work as part of a team, to communicate with all levels of the organization and to adapt quickly to change
  • Strong analytical, organizational and problem solving skills.
  • Knowledge of MS Office, and solid computer skills
  • A self-motivated individual who will work towards Safety & Reliability Excellence
  • Good working knowledge of sawmill and planer mill equipment

 

Only selected candidates will be contacted.

 

We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages. Hiring for this position is ongoing and will be filled as required. To be considered for this position, please apply today!

Our Thunder Bay Sawmill is located at 156 Darrel Avenue, Thunder Bay, ON. The community of Thunder Bay is located in Northwest Ontario. For more information about the region, please visithttp://www.thunderbay.ca/)

title: Foreperson - Foreman in Fort McMurray, Alberta | Careers at North American Construction Group
description:
Position Scope

The successful candidate will work under the direction of superintendents in overseeing workers on site and coordination of operations.

 

As the point of reference for both workers and supervisors, you will be a key component of the success of the project. You should have a solid background in large scale, site-based projects utilizing your leadership skills and experience in the planning, development and coordination of large heavy construction and earthworks projects in the Fort McMurray Alberta area in order to direct the work of others and make quick decisions. In addition Foreman are involved with the interpretation of plans and specifications for projects, contract administration and project controls requirements as well as construction activities associated with the project requirements.

 

You must be well-organized and favour safety above everything else.

  • Site: Syncrude - Aurora
  • Shift: 14x7 - 12 hrs
  • Living out allowance provided.
  • Transportation provided to and from site
  • Temporary position with the potential to turn into long-term employment

 

Candidates with piping and civil experience preferred.

Responsibilities

  • Ensure efficient deployment and productivity of work crews
  • Ensure and enforce compliance to all company, client and legislated Safety policies and procedures
  • Conduct daily and weekly safety meetings and inspections and complete follow-up activities
  • Assess and confirm, through documentation, crew competency
  • Review safe work plans/ hazard assessment with crew prior to job commencement
  • Ensure that all work permits are obtained and adhered to
  • Take corrective action to mitigate immediate hazards, where safe to do so
  • Ensure consistent application of the progressive discipline system
  • Inspect work site before, during and at end of shift
  • Identify surplus equipment and labour resources
  • Operate in a safe and courteous manner at all times
  • Ensure compliance to Corporate and client D&A Policies
  • Ensure all new hires/transfers receive required orientations. Attend and participate in site specific orientations
  • Ensure adequate and suitable safety equipment, including PPE, is supplied, readily accessible, properly used and maintained
  • Promote and ensure the FLRA process is conducted before every task
  • Report and refuse unsafe work. Report unsafe conditions immediately
  • Complete near miss cards/voice cards
  • Report all incidents and hazards to the Supervisor
  • Conduct incident investigations and prepare associated support documentation immediately
  • Report and respond to any harassment issues
  • Identify testing requirements and ensure Subcontractors are available to support daily operations
  • Complete termination/transfer reports and submit to Supervisor
  • Adhere to project, company environmental considerations
  • Identify quantity and scope changes to the Contract and communicate to Supervisor
  • Ensure crews use and understand up to date project cost coding
  • Monitor equipment utilization and report down equipment to Mechanics
  • Review weekly servicing and preventative maintenance schedules
  • Complete daily activity reports/daily logs and submit to Supervisor

Qualifications

  • Five years' experience in any construction supervisory capacity
  • Must have Oil Sands Mining experience
  • Experience with Overburden, Pipe/Culvert installation, road construction and etc
  • Construction supervisory courses or equivalent experience related to supervision of construction operations
  • Mentor fellow workers and lead by example
  • Leadership for Safety Excellence

  • Have a valid Class 5 Driver’s License
  • Have experience as requested in the job description above

  • Undergo and successfully pass the following pre-employment testing:

    • Audiometric Testing

  • CSO Certification
  • Copy of Valid Class 5 Driver’s License
  • Copy of recent Driver’s Abstract
  • VOID cheque/direct deposit form

  • The Rewards of our positions include:  competitive compensation and benefits packages and excellent career growth prospects

     

    To explore this opportunity, please submit a resume of your experience and accomplishments in confidence.

    Become a member of the North American family today!

title: Foreman
description:
ROLE
The Foreman provides leadership in the areas of scheduling, workforce planning and coordination, supervising and promoting cost control measures.  The position ensures safe working practices are followed, as well as consistent and fair application of labour relations, policies and procedures. The position ensures proper apprentice training and the productivity of the crews at the project site. The position is a key participant in relationships with the contractor, company and client and has a further role as a coordinating manager.  The Foreman works in the field as front line leadership to the workforce crews. There are a many discipline specific Foreman positions on a project and each foreman should be experienced in the respective scope of work he/she will be supervising (i.e. earthworks, stringing, welding etc.). In addition, each foreman is responsible for the following.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Supervise construction crews for specific project activities under the direction of an Assistant Superintendent.
  • Provide direction to construction crews of various sizes depending on project activities.
  • Communicate expected production to workforce.
  • Follow project plans and schedules ensuring that crews perform timely activities to meet production goals
  • Provide direction, leadership and support to the Straw Foreman and holds the Straw Foreman accountable for meeting his or her responsibilities.
  • Responsible for on-site reporting of labour, equipment and material (payroll administration, labour coding of time) adhering to Company standards, as it relates to the Foreman’s portion of the project.
  • Responsible for managing site tools and equipment.
  • Report actual production achieved relative to project expectations (estimate).
  • Monitor actual production complete relative to the project schedule.
  • Weekly review of labour performance and production with crew and addresses results and issues to achieve desired performance.
  • Assist with the preparation of execution plans, ITPs, safe work plans, work assignments, and so on.
  • Provide leadership that results in a safe work culture (knows, understands, communicates and ensures compliance).
  • Facilitate “safety toolbox meetings”.
  • Administer effective quality control: overseeing the execution of the work, including quality and production, by ensuring that the crews work to job specifications and follow drawings.  Reviews inspection reports and coordinates resolutions to deficiencies.
  • Assess competency and capability of labourers and tradespersons; evaluates crew capability, trains, and coaches to ensure the crew meets the required level of quality.
  • Support job training for apprentices and facilitates mentoring of apprentices by journeymen.
  • Participate in and support day to day disciplinary decisions and those additional discipline actions deemed appropriate by the project senior management.
  • Mentor Lead Hand/Straw and crew personnel.
  • Recommend personnel actions (hiring, promotions, and corrective action).
  • Identify and report any scheduling conflicts with other crews and contractors.
  • Translate general work requirements into a prioritized work plan for each crew.
  • Review and adjust specific activities and task schedules to meet established production schedules.
  • Prepare reports as required (logs, progress reports, quality control).
  • Supervise supplier’s material-equipment deliveries.
Duties/Tasks
  1. Plan work for week:
  • Labour
  • Equipment
  • Materials
  • Subcontractors Coordination
  1. Direct Daily Work:
  • Crew Personnel
  • Equipment
  • Material Requisition
  • Subcontractor Coordination
  1. Manage and monitor:
  • Quality to project contract specifications
  • Safety to Surerus and OH&S standards
  1. Specific Tasks:
  • Weekly - production - reporting of work functions completed
  • Daily reporting of tradesmen and equipment hours to work functions
Note: In addition to these duties personnel are required to carry out such other duties as may be reasonably required in order to support the objectives of the company.

POSITION REQUIREMENTS
Qualifications
  • Journeyman Ticket Intra-Provincial Trade Certification or alternatively, a technical diploma is considered an asset.
  • National Construction Safety Officer (NCSO) or Construction Safety Officer (CSO) Certificate is considered an asset.
  • Leadership for Safety Excellence (LSE) Course.
  • Various other safety certificates depending on project.
Experience
  • Minimum of 2 years in the construction industry preferably in the oil and gas sector.
  • Minimum of 1 years as a Foreman or Lead Hand.
  • Extensive field supervision experience.
Skills and Knowledge
  • Understanding of the oil and gas pipeline construction industry.
  • Knowledge of the OHS and company safety procedures and standards.
  • Understanding of legal liabilities of the role and of Workers’ Compensation Board reporting time frames and responsibilities.
  • Ability to read and understand construction documents including contracts, drawings, specifications and, subcontracts.
  • Knowledge of construction technology, methods, equipment, tools, procedures, scheduling and cost control.
  • Strong knowledge of scheduling and planning (2 week “look ahead” plan for manpower, material and equipment).
  • Scope of both one’s own and other construction trades.
  • Familiar with CSA, ABSA, CWB, WCB, and Work Safe BC standards and practices.

WORKING CONDITIONS
This position is field based and often works in remote project locations. Travel and/or living in temporary accommodations is required.
 
REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS

title: Technicien(ne) en environnement
description:
Changer le monde, une idée à la fois

Golder est plus qu'un simple lieu de travail, c'est la promesse d'un environnement vivant et dynamique favorisant l'excellence et le développement professionnel et où les gens collaborent, innovent et tissent des liens durables dans le contexte d'une solide culture.

Avez-vous le désir d'apprendre et la motivation nécessaire pour exceller et vous épanouir dans un milieu engagé et axé sur la collaboration?

Golder est à la recherche d'un(e) technicien(ne) en environnement pour nos bureaux à Montréal afin de compléter notre équipe des sites contaminés au service d'un important client dans le secteur pétrolier et gazier. Le candidat retenu sera en charge du travail de terrain, principalement dans le domaine de la caractérisation et de la réhabilitation environnementale de sites contaminés par des hydrocarbures (diesel, essence, pétrole brut, etc.) et/ou autres contaminants. Le candidat doit être motivé et démontrer de solides compétences en gestion du temps et en communication.

Un aperçu de votre rôle inclura :

  • Préparer et adhérer aux plans de santé et de sécurité propres à chaque site afin d'atténuer ou d'éliminer les risques pour vous, pour les clients de Golder, pour les employés et pour le public;
  • Identifier et rapporter les risques existants ou potentiels, les quasi- incidents et les incidents avec perte de temps, particuliers aux sites;
  • Produire d'excellentes notes de terrain et effectuer la collecte des échantillons de sol et des eaux souterraines;
  • Réaliser les travaux sur le terrain (c.-à-d. échantillonnage des eaux souterraines, collecte de données et analyse, échantillonnages des sols par forage ou par excavation, supervision des sous-traitants, etc.) et du travail de bureau sous la direction d'employés plus expérimentés;
  • Superviser les sous-traitants pour des travaux de caractérisation ou de réhabilitation environnementale;
  • Préparer et coordonner la documentation de projet, en ce qui a trait aux sous-traitants et à l'équipement ou pour les programmes sur le terrain;
  • Classifier et gérer les notes de terrain liées aux projets incluant la saisie des données et la collaboration permettant la préparation des rapports d'études;
  • Exécuter les diverses tâches efficacement et tel que demandé, tout en adhérant aux normes actuelles de l'industrie et aux exigences réglementaires.

Vous devez posséder les aptitudes suivantes :

  • Diplôme d'études collégiales en environnement et en sciences naturelles ou de la terre;
  • Attitude positive et enthousiaste, volonté d'apprendre et capacité de travailler avec peu de supervision;
  • Démontrer un grand intérêt en lien avec les questions de santé et de sécurité et attitude de sécurité avant tout;
  • Force au niveau des relations interpersonnelles et en communication, avec une attention particulière aux détails et à la précision des notes de terrain;
  • Permis de conduire valide;
  • Expérience antérieure avec l'échantillonnage des sols et des eaux souterraines, un atout;
  • Admissibilité à la certification professionnelle, un atout.

Pourquoi choisir Golder:

  • Formation, mentorat et accompagnement en entreprise
  • Approfondissez votre expertise dans un milieu de travail dynamique
  • Projets pluridisciplinaires innovants et collaboratifs
  • Formation, mentorat et accompagnement en entreprise
  • Projets internationaux et opportunités de travailler à l'étranger

L'une des sociétés les mieux gérées au Canada, détenant un statut de membre Platine depuis 13 années consécutives.

Reconnue pour son excellence technique, Golder est une entreprise chef de file œuvrant à l'échelle mondiale qui regroupe des experts-conseils spécialisés dans le domaine de l'ingénierie. Nous fournissons des services de grande qualité à nos clients depuis plus d'un demi-siècle. Avec une présence dans plus de 30 pays à travers le monde, nos effectifs, qui comptent quelque 6500 professionnels répartis dans plus de 165 bureaux et qui possèdent des compétences uniques pour relever les défis en constante évolution dans les domaines des sciences de la Terre, de l'environnement et de l'énergie, sont animés par la passion de livrer des résultats à des clients œuvrant dans les secteurs des infrastructures, minier, pétrolier et gazier, manufacturier ainsi que de l'énergie.

Golder s'engage à assurer une approche équitable ainsi que des opportunités équivalentes pour tous les candidats. À ce titre, Golder fournira sur demande des accommodations aux candidats ayant un handicap, et ce, à travers toutes les étapes du processus de recrutement, si demandé.

description:
Company Description

Looking for work that provides value and impact for yourself and the environment?

Growing over 5 billion trees to date, PRT is a pioneer in the commercial scale containerized growing of over 200 tree species to help regenerate future forests across Canada and the United States.

Be part of a team that grows trees which are key in reducing air pollution and contribute to the mitigation of climate-change.

Job Description

PRT Summerland is currently hiring Nursery Workers to assist with seedling sowing & seedling thinning for SPRING and SUMMER work! (Check out the links to see a video on seedling thinning)

This engaging, high paced, physical position offers a safe work environment and an opportunity for a career that will make a positive change in the world.

What a position with PRT offers:

o    Hourly rates start at $17.00/hr for the training period, compensation then transfers to piece work for thinning, withgreater earning potential (average for 2021 season was over $20.00/hr); motivated and efficient workers have no upper limit on piece earnings!

o    Work is available approx. March 29 to the end of June, with an opportunity to join other projects. There may be short breaks in between thinning projects.

o    No experience required; full training provided

o    Our PRT nurseries are vibrant and fun communities with employees who share a strong passion for the “green” nature of our business and doing their part in regenerating the forests of North America

o    We provide a supportive team structured environment with a strong safety cultur

Qualifications

What you need for a position with PRT:

·         Energetic with attention to detail

·         Positive attitude and a team player

·         Work is meticulous and requires good eyesight and manual dexterity

·         You will stand for lengthy periods of time, walking, repetitive lifting, (light to medium weight objects), and perform repetitive movements

·         Mostly indoor greenhouse work , must be prepared to work in outdoor elements as well

·         Appropriate attire required (raingear, sunhat, sunglasses, non-slip footwear, water)

·         Reliable transportation is essential

Want to learn a little more about a career with PRT? Check out our video on You Tube; https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AsvfZdw_9m0



Additional Information

How to Apply:

Apply in person, Monday to Friday between the hours of 8:00 am – 4:00 pm

8333 McLachlan Street, Summerland B.C.

Or apply online to  Debbie, Nursery Manager to arrange a meeting time!

Join us in growing forests for future generations!
